crypto_challenges.name: Caesar Cipher Decryption
crypto_challenges.description: Decrypt a message that was encrypted using a Caesar cipher with an unknown shift.
hints: The Caesar cipher is a type of substitution cipher in which each letter in the plaintext is shifted a certain number of places down the alphabet.
You can perform a frequency analysis on the encrypted text to guess the shift used.

crypto_challenges.name: AES Encryption Challenge
crypto_challenges.description: Given an AES-encrypted text and the key, decrypt the message.
hints: Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) is a symmetric encryption algorithm.
The same key is used for both encrypting and decrypting the data.

crypto_challenges.name: 3DES Decryption Challenge
crypto_challenges.description: Decrypt a message that was encrypted with Triple DES using the provided keys.
hints: Triple DES uses three individual keys with DES.
Ensure the correct mode of operation is used.

crypto_challenges.name: Image Steganography
crypto_challenges.description: Retrieve the hidden message from an image file using steganographic techniques.
hints: Look for the least significant bits of the image pixels.
The message may be encoded in a pattern across the image.

test_cases.output: The hidden message is: 'AI will lead the future.'

crypto_challenges.name: Binary Reverse Engineering
crypto_challenges.description: Analyze the provided binary file to find the secret key.
hints: Use disassemblers and debuggers to understand the binary's structure.
Look for cryptographic function calls within the binary.
